hanzi-su-wiki:
魅

Значения

Очаровывать, околдовывать

Мнемоника

Колдовать, пока не 未 станет мерещиться всякая чертовщина 鬼.

demon; magic; to charm
демон; магия; очаровывать
rtega_mnemonic:
魅魅RSkind of forest demon, elf, charm, mislead
  • goblin 鬼 sitting at the end of a tree near the buds 未: charming and misleading demon
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: A forest 未 demon 鬼; 未 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
魅力 [ mèi lì ]: charm; fascination; glamor; charisma
鬼魅 [ guǐ mèi ]: demon; monster
魅惑 [ mèi huò ]: to entice; to charm
魑魅魍魉 [ chī mèi wǎng liǎng ]: demons and monsters (idiom)
魅力四射 [ mèi lì sì shè ]: glamorous; charming; seductive
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿺ Surround from lower left
    • 鬼 [ guǐ ] ghost; demon; sly, mischievous
    • 未 [ wèi ] not yet; 8th terrestrial branch
heisig_chinese_memo: Humans have not yet given up their fascination with enchanting ghosts.
heisig_constituent: fascination, ghost, oni, drop, brains, rice field, human legs, elbow, not yet, one, tree, wood
koohiiStory1: Ghosts have not yet left the world, they must still have a deep fascination with their past life on Earth.
koohiiStory2: Here the "Ghostbusters" founder talks about his fascination for ghosts (picture Dan Arkroyd in the movie if that helps). He says he has a fascination for ghosts ever since he saw one as a teenager. Since then he´s been scouring all of the world, trying to capture them on tape, on video... A journalist asks "When will it end ? Aren´t you tired of chasing ghosts ?" "Oh no, not yet ! Not until I become a ghost myself anyway !".
jp_example_words: 魅力(みりょく): charm, fascination, glamour
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A demon on a jet is pretty alluring. Demons themselves are pretty intriguing, but put one on a jet? Now that’s alluring.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: See this demon flying around in his jet. Do you feel allured? You should. Hear the roar of the jet engine as the demon cackles.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This alluring demon on a jet wants one thing and one thing only. Meat (み). Human meat. This demon needs human meat to survive so he is taking his jet into the city to feast on some meat.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The demon won’t be so alluring once you see him scarfing down humans, tearing the meat from their bones. How gross.
Ru_Radicals: ｜, 二 (два), 亠 (крышка), 儿 (ножки), ハ, 匕 (ложка), 木 (дерево), 田 (рисовое поле), 鬼 (чёрт)
Ru_trainchinese: mèi: (графема) демон, бес, злой дух
Kanshudo_mnemonic: it's not yet (未) an ogre (鬼), it's still charming
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Humans have not yet given up their fascination with enchanting ghosts.
humanum_short_description_en: " Charm ", the ancient work "鬽", the variants are also called " 𢑘 " and " 𧱋 " "Said Wen": "Yi, old Jingwu also. From the ghost 彡. 彡, ghost hair. Charm, or never sound. 𢑘, ancient prose. 𧱋, 籒文 from the beginning, from the end of the sound."
humanum_short_description: 「魅」，古作「鬽」，異體又作「𢑘」、「𧱋」。《說文》：「鬽，老精物也。从鬼彡。彡，鬼毛。魅，或从未聲。𢑘，古文。𧱋，籒文从彖首，从尾省聲。」

Seal characters (1)

魅字的基本解释

魅
mèi
〔魅力〕很能吸引人的力量。
传说中的鬼怪：鬼魅。

魅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mèi］
［《廣韻》明祕切，去至，明。］
亦作“1”。亦作“鬽1”。
(1)旧时迷信认为物老变成的精怪。
(2)鬼怪。
(3)媚，迷惑。

魅字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【鬼字部】　魅； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1461第30
〔古文〕?【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?明祕切，音媚。【說文】鬽，或作魅。【左傳·文十八年】投諸四裔，以禦螭魅。【註】螭魅，山林異氣所生，爲人害者。又【宣三年】螭魅罔兩。【註】怪物。【史記·五帝紀註】螭魅，人面獸身四足，好惑人。

魅字的源字形

魅字的起名意思

迷信传说中所谓的"鬼怪"。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mèi］
["Guangyun" Ming secretly cuts, goes to the end, Ming. ]
Also known as "1". Also known as "鬽1".
(1) The old superstition believed that things become strange when they are old.
(2) Ghosts.
(3) Charming and confusing.
Charm
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Haiji 1] [Ghost Character Department] 　mei; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 1461 30
[Ancient text]? [Guangyun] [Jiyun] [Yunhui]? Ming and secret, charming. [Speaking text] 鬽, or charming. [Zuo Zhuan·Eighteenth Year of Wen] To cast all four descents to protect against the charm. [Note] Chimei, born by the abnormal qi in the mountains and forests, is a person who harms people. Also 【Xuan Sany】The charm of the two is indifferent. [Note] Monster. [Historical Records·Annotation to the Five Emperors] Charm, human face and animal body four legs, so deceptive.

Source glyph
Charm
Name meaning
The so-called "ghosts" in superstition legends.
魅
魅
甲骨文
(mèi)
小篆
一个头上冒着汗的鬼魅,具有人类难以
逃脫的力量。
魅
“魅”是个象形字,本义是鬼魅,也就是迷信传说中所说的精怪。《说文》
中解释为“魅,老精物也”。甲骨文的“魅”,字形就像是头上冒着汗的“人”
形,表明这是个怪物。《说文》所载的籍文“魅”,上方是“鬼”,下方的线条,
表示鬼身上长着长毛。小篆的重文写法,由“鬼”和“彡”组成。“魅”字现
在引申为能吸引人的力量,如“魅力”。
隶书
魅
楷体
Очарование
Очарование
(mèi)
Призрак с потом на голове обладает силой, от которой люди не могут избавиться.
Очарование
«Мэй» - это пиктографический персонаж с изначальным значением призраков, что является духом суеверий.
В «Шуовэнь» это интерпретируется как «очарование старого Цзинву».
«Очарование» Оракула похоже на «человеческую» фигуру с потом на голове, что указывает на то, что это монстр.
В книге «Мэй», содержащейся в «Шуовэнь», верхняя часть - это «призрак», а нижняя строка указывает на то, что у призрака длинные волосы.
Переписывание Сяочжуаня состоит из «призрака» и «彡».
Слово «мэй» теперь распространяется на силу, которая может привлекать людей, например «очарование».
Очарование
Курсив

Radicals: 鬼, 未  (demon, jet)
Meaning Mnemonic
A demon on a jet is pretty alluring. Demons themselves are pretty intriguing, but put one on a jet? Now that’s alluring.
See this demon flying around in his jet. Do you feel allured? You should. Hear the roar of the jet engine as the demon cackles.
Reading Mnemonic
This alluring demon on a jet wants one thing and one thing only. Meat (み). Human meat. This demon needs human meat to survive so he is taking his jet into the city to feast on some meat.
The demon won’t be so alluring once you see him scarfing down humans, tearing the meat from their bones. How gross.
